item.title: Installation
item.description: Install the Deno CLI. This is for mac. Other installation methods can be found here. curl -fsSL https://deno.land/install.sh | sh Ensure deno is available in the environment path deno --version Install vscode deno extension. Open the VS Code command palette with Ctrl+Shift+P, and run the Deno: Initialize Workspace Configuration command.

item.title: Create webapp directory
item.description: This will be the working directory of your web application. mkdir webapp && cd webapp Open vscode editor from the working directory code .

item.title: Create entry point file
item.description: import application from "https://deno.land/x/fastro@v0.54.0/server/mod.ts"; const app = application(); app.get("/", () => "Hello world"); await app.serve();

item.title: Run locally
item.description: You can run the webapp from local deno run -A --unstable main.ts Or try running a simple program from repo: deno run -A --unstable https://deno.land/x/fastro@v0.54.0/examples/main.ts

item.title: Deployments
item.description: When clicking the “Deploy” button – deno-deploy will automatically download all the application code and create a new deployment. Other deployment methods can be seen here.
